quoteFirst: [14] The guard is relieved at forty-five minutes after ten. At that hour the new guard marched into the Palace Yard, and at
quoteLast: the child was born. The question arises which officer is entitled to the promotion. The officer of the fresh guard claims it because the relief marched in before the birth, and the keys were delivered over to him; but the other officer claims it because the sentries had not been changed when the child was actually born, his men were still on guard, and he disputes the fact of the delivery of the keys, arguing that in all probability this had not occurred at the moment of the birth.
title:
The Greville Memoirs, Part 2 (of 3), Volume 2 (of 3)
A Journal of the Reign of Queen Victoria from 1837 to 1852
author: Greville, Charles, 1794-1865

quoteFirst: Soon after the communist takeover the combined elementary-secondary period of schooling was reduced from
quoteLast: years. The objectives of a secondary education were described in the following terms: "the general promotion of the physical and intellectual development of adolescents, the weaning of their minds from extreme nationalist and reactionary ideas, the inculcation of the spirit of progress, and preparation for creative participation in the economic and cultural life of the country.
title: Area Handbook for Bulgaria
author: Keefe, Eugene K., 1922-2005; Baluyut, Violeta D., 1936-; Giloane, William; Long, Anne K.; Moore, James M.; Walpole, Neda A.

quoteFirst: The seventh egg hatched four hours later making its period of incubation eleven days and eight hours nearly.” After another similar experience with the hatching of nine marked eggs, which extended over a period from 5:40 a. m. one day until
quoteLast: the next day, she says: “Roughly speaking, then, the time that our Flickers take for incubation is from eleven to twelve days.”
title: Life histories of North American woodpeckers
author: Bent, Arthur Cleveland, 1866-1954

quoteFirst: Yale had won the first game by heavy batting, the final score being
quoteLast: . As the regular 'Varsity nine had likewise won the first of their series with Harvard, the "Sons of Eli" began to think they had a sure thing, and those who came on from New Haven were dead sure in their minds that they would bring back the scalps of the Harvard freshmen.
title: Frank Merriwell at Yale; Or, Freshman Against Freshman

quoteFirst: A second rabbit, which weighed 1,630 grams, was fed with a solution of 0.5 gram of the same salt at 9.42 a.m. At 10.35 a.m. the animal passed soft stools and showed a marked disinclination to move, with evidence of pain. The diarrhea[192] became more marked and the animal's hind quarters were soiled with feces. At
quoteLast: there was marked incoordination of the limbs and inability to stand. Finally, at 10.56 a. m., convulsions began and the animal died at 11.02 a.m. The autopsy was made about two hours later. The animal was then rigid.
title: Barium: A Cause of the Loco-Weed Disease
author: Crawford, Albert C. (Albert Cornelius), 1869-1921
